DOC.brief_title: Cardiovascular Outcomes Study Naltrexone SR/Bupropion SR Overweight Obese Subjects With Cardiovascular Risk Factors ( The Light Study )
DOC.criteria: 1 . ≥50 year age ( woman ) ≥45 year age ( men ) 2 . Body mass index ( BMI ) ≥27 kg/m2 ≤50 kg/m2 3 . Waist circumference ≥88 cm ( woman ) ≥102 cm ( men ) 4 . At increase risk adverse cardiovascular outcome : Cardiovascular disease ( confirm diagnosis high likelihood cardiovascular disease ) least one following : History document myocardial infarction > 3 month prior screen History coronary revascularization History carotid peripheral revascularization Angina ischemic change ( rest ECG ) , ECG change grade exercise test ( GXT ) , positive cardiac imaging study Ankle brachial index < 0.9 ( simple palpation ) within prior 2 year ≥50 % stenosis coronary , carotid , low extremity artery within prior 2 year AND/OR Type 2 diabetes mellitus least 2 follow : Hypertension ( control without pharmacotherapy < 145/95 mm Hg ) Dyslipidemia require pharmacotherapy Documented low HDL cholesterol ( < 50 mg/dL woman < 40 mg/dL men ) within prior 12 month Current tobacco smoker 1 . Myocardial infarction within 3 month prior screen 2 . Angina pectoris Grade III IV per Canadian Cardiovascular Society grade scheme 3 . Clinical history cerebrovascular disease ( stroke ) 4 . History tachyarrhythmia sinus tachycardia 5 . Planned bariatric surgery , cardiac surgery , coronary angioplasty 6 . History seizure ( include febrile seizure ) , cranial trauma , condition predispose subject seizure 7 . History mania current diagnosis active psychosis , active bulimia anorexia nervosa ( binge eat disorder exclusionary ) 8 .
